title: is this considered grifing?
body: a player on my team. i had a hard lane so i asked him not to gank me. what did he do? ganked me. didnt kill him. so what did he do? went away. came back WITH 30% HP AGAINST A ZED and gave him a kill. after this he said "lag" (sure) we all asked him to go tank cuz he was really behind. so he went even more damage. not helping in team fights. going in to 5 people alone. and more. is this reportable?

replies.body: That might be considered intentionally feeding, which, if the system comes to that conclusion, would lead to a 14-day ban.

Yea but I doubt the system would flag that as intentionally feeding because it could just be a bad player lmao. I've never seen someone gets banned for soft core inting. The fact that inters can int more than 40+ games in ranked until they get on Reddit just shows enough about the system.

> [{quoted}](name=Punctual,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2EG45WEk,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-01-13T16:03:21.972+0000)
>
> Yea but I doubt the system would flag that as intentionally feeding because it could just be a bad player lmao. I've never seen someone gets banned for soft core inting. The fact that inters can int more than 40+ games in ranked until they get on Reddit just shows enough about the system.

The system makes interesting decisions these days.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/GbeI8c7p-what-intentionally-feeding-looks-like-in-2019
The griffin, griffon, or gryphon is a legendary creature with the body, tail, and back legs of a lion; the head and wings of an eagle; and sometimes an eagle's talons as its front feet.
